Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery open vessel, a column krater or more likely stamnos; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of right arm of figure raised, to left; on left, head of thyrsos with two berries and top of stalk in added white.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E812.6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0173) (Phase 1)
